results.title: Gary's story
results.creator_credit: Richard Michalak, Rolf De Heer and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A comical drama about a young man’s search for sexual filfilment. Gary (John Howard) awkwardly obsesses over finding a girlfriend. He heads off to Sydney for a new job with many expectations, leaving his flatmate and those ‘desperate vibes’ behind. Unable to assert himself, Gary sabotages his dreams of sexual fulfillment by allowing a neurotic acquaintance (Joyce) from his desperate past to infiltrate and dominate his life. The director Richard Michalak offers a number of humorous asides playfully referencing the film-making process. When his dreams are shattered, Gary tries to sort out the mess and promptly delivers a script with the demand “this is my story and I want an up ending”. Cast includes John Howard, Katrina Foster, Kate Fitzpatrick and Patrick Ward.

results.title: Garrison at Dhurringile: officers p.o.w. camp Tatura
results.brief_description: Footage of Dhurringile, the internment camp and military hospital, Tatura during or possibly just after the second world war. Tatura housed refugees from Europe and South East Asia (classified as enemy aliens) and was also a P.O.W. camp, housing German officers and batmen from the merchant ship Kormoran which sank HMAS Sydney in 1941. This film deals with an unknown parade outside the camp (possibly ANZAC) populated by soldiers from both world wars.

results.title: Garin Nugroho: my family, my film and my nation
results.creator_credit: Garin Nugroho and S E T Film Workshop
results.brief_description: Garin Nugroho narrates this collage of his own documentaries and films. He talks about the films and how he associates them with his personal life. There are clips from his feature ‘Letter for an Angel’ and documentaries ‘Water and Romi’ and ‘Tale of a Mousedeer’ which inspired the feature ‘Leaf on a Pillow’. Nugroho also articulates his concerns for the failing condition of his country. In Bahasa Indonesia with English subtitles.

results.title: Gardens of the Caribbean
results.creator_credit: Emma Halit, Carole Mattison, Royal Horticultural Society (Great Britain) and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description: The climate of the Caribbean fosters exuberantly coloured gardens. In this documentary Anne Swithinbank visits some of the wonderful sights in the area including; swamps and rain forests in Trinidad, Grenada and Golden Eye in Jamaica, Balata Gardens in Martinique, Andromeda Gardens in Barbados, vegetable plots in Jamaica and a squatter’s garden in Trinidad. Join Anne for an armchair guide of the fabulous Caribbean.

results.title: Gardens of South Africa
results.creator_credit: Gary Johnston, Royal Horticultural Society (Great Britain) and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description: South Africa has an abundance of beautiful gardens and this video provides the viewer with an overview of some of them. Sites visited include; the Modjadji Cycad Forest, Garden Route, Cape Point, the Botanic Gardens at Kirstenbosch and a trip to Brenthurst. From viewing these gardens you can identify many familiar garden plants, only this time they’re found in their country of origin.

results.title: Gardening secrets: Summer
results.brief_description: Eion Scarrow, a professional gardener for 40 years, is New Zealand’s best known gardening personality. He and his wife, Ann, own a magnificent display garden in the Waikato, “Willow Glen Gardens”. Using their own garden to demonstrate summer gardening tips, they explain how to care for potted plants when you go away on holidays, how to compost in an open frame structure; care and pruning of citrus trees; mineral deficiencies in the soil; spraying programs and protective equipment for garden pests and diseases; care of variegated plants; deadheading; mulching; safety and care of motor mowers and lawn watering systems and care and preparation of the vegetable garden.

results.title: Gardening secrets: Spring
results.brief_description: In this program devoted to care of the spring garden, well-known New Zealand gardening expert, Eion Scarrow and his wife, Ann, demonstrate the propagation, planting and care of spring vegetables; the planting and care of citrus trees; the pruning of citrus, apples, cherries and camellias; the propagation and potting of indoor plants; basic hydroponics; the preparation and care of a herb garden; broad leaf weed control in lawns; care of garden tools; and summer perennials. Filmed on location at the Scarrow’s garden, Willow Glen, in the Waikato.

results.title: Garden party
results.creator_credit: Jack Sholder, Paul R. Gurian and ACI Films
results.brief_description: An adaptation of a short story by Katherine Mansfield, presenting a story about a garden party which continues uninterrupted by a neighbourhood death. Helps stimulate discussion on the meaning of death. A sensitive approach to a difficult theme. It is recommended that teachers preview this film before screening.

results.title: Garden of the great spirit
results.creator_credit: Barry Gray, Gary Johnson, Amaranth Productions and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The St Lawrence Islands National Park, located in the Thousand Islands, Ontario, is an area of great natural beauty and historic interest. Geography and weather have created a greater variety of plant life here than anywhere ales in Canada. The film points out the park’s main features while reminding the audience that conservation must be practised to protect the fragile balance of nature. Narrated by Cy Stranger, camera by David M. Ostricker.
